fields.description:
@Value(users.user_id) , which means the value will be set with the users.user_id value

@Where(users.active=true)

fields.description: @Value(users.client_id) The client_id of the user creating this records

fields.description: @Value(users.user_id)

fields.name: updated by
fields.description: @Value(users.user_id)

fields.name: name
fields.description:
This is @Required it has @DisplayLength(50) - 50 character in display length a @MinLength(1) and @MaxLength(100) - Do not go over 100 characters or else the system will throw a ValueTooLong exception
can also be express with @Length(1-100)

fields.name: description
fields.description:
@DisplayLength(100) When building a UI for this field
@MaxLength(200) Do not go over 200 character on this one

fields.description: @Active

fields.name: info
fields.description:
{color:"red",
dimension:"10x20x30",
dimensionUnit:"mm",
weight:"4",
weightUnit:"kg"
}

fields.name: seq no
fields.description: @Sequence can be used to do alternate ordering of the values, when alphetical or time can not be used

fields.name: upfront fee
fields.description: Applicable to services, usually services has an upfront fee

fields.name: barcode
fields.description: barcode if scanning the product, conflict can happen, expect to return matching list of products using the barcode

fields.name: owner
fields.description: Whom this product belongs, since created_by can be someone else create the product list in behalf of the owner of the product

fields.description: which country uses this currency
